statements.name: PROC ERQUERY
statements.description: The ERQUERY procedure queries a compound store to find all entities and networks that correspond to one or more specified document IDs. You must specify the document type and the document ID that you want to query.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the documents to query. These are the seed documents where the network traversal begins.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTTYPES=
arguments.description: specifies the document types to include in the results. By default, all document types are included.

arguments.name: ENTITYTYPES=
arguments.description: specifies the entity types to include in the results. By default, all entity types are included.

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of documents to be searched in a path before the search is stopped. A value of 0 includes all documents that can be reached from the starting documents or compounds.

statements.name: COMPOUNDSTORE
statements.description: The COMPOUNDSTORE statement enables you to specify the tables to use for the compound store.

arguments.name: COMPOUNDTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store compounds.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store documents.

arguments.name: ENTITYTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store entities.

arguments.name: LOCKTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table to use for preventing access to the compound store by other sessions while a procedure is running.

arguments.name: METADATATABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store the metadata, including the element, compound, and entity definitions.

statements.name: DOCUMENT
statements.description: The DOCUMENT statement enables you to specify a document to query.

arguments.name: ID=
arguments.description: specifies the ID of the document.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of the document.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement enables you to specify the table to use for output and other output options.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the output table in which to store results of the procedure.

arguments.name: OUTCOMPOUNDVALUE
arguments.description: includes in the output table the compound_value column, which contains a concatenation of the element values that make up the compound value.

arguments.name: OUTSOFTDELETE=
arguments.description: specifies how to output soft-deleted items. You can specify the following values:

arguments.name: ADJACENT
arguments.description: includes in the output soft-deleted items that are connected to the generated networks.

arguments.name: AUTOMATIC
arguments.description: uses ADJACENT if you specify a SOFTDELETE statement; otherwise, it uses NONE.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not include soft-deleted items in the output.

arguments.name: OUTSUBENTITYID
arguments.description: includes in the output table the _subentity_id_ column, which contains a subentity ID as determined by temporal splitting. By default, temporal splitting is enabled for an entity soft-deletion; otherwise it is disabled.

statements.name: SOFTDELETE
statements.description: The SOFTDELETE statement enables you to specify rules for soft-deleting documents, entities, and links. The rules that you specify affect the network generation step.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method of soft-deletion.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of document to which the soft-deletion rule applies when METHOD=DOCUMENT.

arguments.name: MAXENTITYCOUNT=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of entities to which a document can be connected before being soft-deleted when METHOD=DOCUMENT.

arguments.name: MAXENTITYCOUNTBYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a collection of entity type and count pairs for defining document soft-deletions when METHOD=DOCUMENT. The document is soft-deleted if the number of connections that it has to entities of the type that you specify in the TYPE= suboption exceeds the value of the COUNT= suboption.

arguments.name: ENTITYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of entity to which the soft-deletion rule applies when METHOD=ENTITY.

arguments.name: MAXDOCUMENTCOUNT=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of documents to which an entity can be connected before being soft-deleted when METHOD=ENTITY.

arguments.name: MAXDOCUMENTCOUNTBYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a collection of document type and count pairs for defining entity soft-deletions when METHOD=ENTITY. The entity is soft-deleted if it violates any of the rules.

arguments.name: TEMPORALSPLITTING
arguments.description: temporally splits entities of this type into subentities when METHOD=ENTITY.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of document to which the soft-deletion rule applies when METHOD=LINK.

arguments.name: ENTITYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of entity to which the soft-deletion rule applies when METHOD=LINK.

arguments.name: ATTRIBUTES=
arguments.description: specifies a collection of attribute names and values for defining document soft-deletions for any METHOD= option value. The object is soft-deleted if it contains any of the listed attribute names and values.

statements.name: SPLITCONFLICTINGENTITY
statements.description: The SPLITCONFLICTINGENTITY statement enables you to specify rules for splitting entities on the basis of conflicting compound values.

arguments.name: COMPOUNDTYPES=
arguments.description: specifies the types of compounds whose values must be consistent within an entity. If an entity contains different values for a compound type in this list, the entity splits into one or more entities such that each entity contains one value for each compound type in this list.

arguments.name: ENTITYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of entity to which the entity splitting rule applies.

arguments.name: DONOTSPLIT=
arguments.description: specifies the pairs that consist of a document type and a compound type that should not be split during entity splitting.
